properties.name: 7th Annual NEBA Ride Through the Rockies
properties.description: Posted by Chris NEBA - National Educated Biker's Association, that helps to educate motorcyclists on real life safety. We are putting on a special Motorcycle Ride and Poker Run on September 16th, starting in Colorado Springs and riding through the local mountain areas to benefit the Colorado Springs Marion House. Check out the following website for more information on the services that the Marion House provides: http://www.ccharitiescs.org/MHSK/aboutus.htm How can you help? - You may not own a motorcycle, but you probably know someone who does... please pass this along to your friends who might be interested! - If you own a motorcycle, contact me to get registered for the ride and come out and support the cause! - Donate directly to the Marion House and let them know NEBA sent you! - If you have a break room or bulletin board at work (or your spouses work) where you could post a flyer advertising the ride, let us know and help spread the word about this special fundraiser!

properties.name: ABC'S OF APARTMENT BUYING
properties.description: Posted by Chris TOM HENDERSON will be teaching you the basics of how to analyze income producing property. The value of income producing property is based on INCOME or Cash Flow, not comps. TOM HENDERSON will be teaching you the basics of how to analyze income producing property. The value of income producing property is based on INCOME or Cash Flow, not comps. Tom will take the mystery out of how much to pay for apartments. The following is only part of what you will learn: What is an APOD and how it is used (Annual Property Operating Data) What is a cap rate? What it tells you and what it does not and how it can make you RICH How to buy at ONE cap rate and flip at another to make tens and even thousands of dollars How to reconstruct expenses and income What Price Per Unit tells you and why it can be a trap What is a Gross Rent Multiplier and how it can be deceptive How to determine the property\'s NOI (Net Operating Income) and why this figure is critical How to determine cash on cash return (This can be the most important key to your purchase) How to correctly determine occupancy rates (What brokers will not tell you) The Magic Circle formula for determining Cap Rates, Value of Property and Income Due diligence check list and what must not be skipped How to VERIFY, VERIFY, VERIFY What is Debt Service Coverage Ratio ans why this is important What is Net Cash Flow and how it gets you the loan or keep you from going broke What is Internal Rate of Return and how brokers use this to sell property (Do not fall for it) Poker Strategy for Buying Income Property Three traps to avoid when purchasing apartments Three magic rules when purchasing income property Three different manangement techniques (Do not believe you will not be managing) How to keep and attract tenants 25 questions you should ask when interviewing a property manager Draw backs of apartments that Gurus will not tell you How to find apartments (What to look for and what to pass up) 7 no nonsense ways to finance apartments with little or nothing down How to use owner financing to buy and to sell One sure way to never overpaying Exit Strategies (What Gurus DO NOT tell you) Real Examples to study and evaluate (BRING YOUR OWN DEALS TO ANALYZE IN CLASS) AND MUCH MORE!!!!! Buying income property can produce fortunes in a very short amount of time. Whether you are looking for cash flow or instant obscene profits, once you understand the basics, you will have the skills necessary to determine which apartments to purchase and which to pass on. Sunday session will go in depth into financing and people who have taken this class before may take this portion without repeating Saturday. Organized by DFWREINDFWREIN The Dallas / Fort Worth Real Estate Investor Network Investor Center 12801 N. Stemmons Frwy #700 Valley View & I-35 Dallas, TX 75234 INFO@DFWREIN.COM 972-671-7346

properties.name: Playing Championship Hold'em - Course 301
properties.description: Posted by ChrisClass: Playing Championship Hold\'em - Course 301Lab: YesProfessor: Tom "The Professor" McEvoy with a guest Professor from Roosevelt UniversityMaterials: IncludedClass Schedule: 5:00 p.m. - 6:00 p.m. - Registration 6:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. - Playing Championship Hold\'em - Course 301 9:30 p.m. - 12:30 a.m. - Poker Lab - Charity Tournament By paying for this event:I hereby waive all claims against Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker, its officers, sponsors or any personnel for any injury I might suffer in this event. Neither Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker nor any of its officers, directors, members, employees, contractors, sponsors, charities and non-profits or agents have or assume any responsibility for any personal injury, property damage or other loss which may be suffered by any attendees, whether arising from (1) wrongful or negligent acts or omissions by any supplier or any employee of a supplier; (2) any defect or any failure of any equipment or instrumentality owned or operated by a supplier; or (3) any wrongful or negligent act or omission on the part of any party other than Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker. Further, some of the services to Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker are provided by outside suppliers whose operations, personnel and equipment are not under the control of Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker. You agree that you will not do any gambling outside the rules of Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker or rules established for the charity poker tournament that follows, or otherwise in violation of any applicable law while at attending the event. I attest that I am physically fit and prepared for this event. I grant full permission for organizers to use photographs of me and quotations from me in the legitimate accounts and promotions of this and future events. After clicking ORDER NOW you will be asked to fill in Student information. If you are paying for additional students you will be contacted for their information.Organized by Tom McEvoy\'s School of Poker Tom McEvoys School of Poker is an exclusive classroom experience focusing on the game of Texas Hold\'em. The courses were written by Tom The Professor McEvoy, one of the worlds most successful and respected professional poker players, poker authors and poker educators who shares the secrets to his success. Learn from Tom McEvoy, the first satellite poker player ever to gain a seat in the World Series of Pokerand win the title, how he has maintained a career that continues to result in tournament wins against the top players in the world. Tom McEvoys School of Poker is an exclusive classroom experience focusing on the game of Texas Hold\'em. The courses were written by Tom The Professor McEvoy, one of the worlds most successful and respected professional poker players, poker authors and poker educators who shares the secrets to his success. Learn from Tom McEvoy, the first satellite poker player ever to gain a seat in the World Series of Pokerand win the title, how he has maintained a career that continues to result in tournament wins against the top players in the world. Following the classroom lectures, students will move to Tom McEvoys School of Poker Lab where they pay and play in a charity poker tournament, with Tom McEvoy offering insight into the hands of some of the players. The game will not only benefit a charity, but result in cash prizes and other winnings for participants. The classes and lab are a special time for students to meet one of the greats of the gameand learn a thing or two about winning poker that could pay off at their next table. Course Materials: Included for all classes

properties.description: Posted by Chris Participants of the poker run will pick up a map at the Sonic located on South York and Chandler in Muskogee. The map will direct them to 5 different locations in Muskogee and then players will return to Sonic. Begins at 7pm. properties.name: Poker Run to End Violence
properties.description: Posted by Chris A fun way to spend the morning while making a difference in the community! Jump on your motorcycle, bring some friends, and come on over. Event registration includes a goody bag, food, entertainment, and prizes. First 250 riders guaranteed Run Pins. ALL MOTORCYCLES WELCOME. A fun way to spend the morning while making a difference in the community! Jump on your motorcycle, bring some friends, and come on over. Event registration includes a goody bag, food, entertainment, and prizes. First 250 riders guaranteed Run Pins. ALL MOTORCYCLES WELCOME. REGISTRATION OPEN 8-9:30am; RUN BEGINS AT 10am. Visit our website at www.valleytraumacenter.org to download a sponsor sheet! High hand wins 00; Low hand wins 00. ALL PROCEEDS BENEFIT VALLEY TRAUMA CENTER, a non-profit organization offering free and low-cost services to children, adults, and families affected by violence. Run begins at Classic American Motorcycles on 2636 Thousand Oaks Blvd. in Thousand Oaks and ends at Woodley Park on Woodley between Burbank Blvd. and Victory Blvd. in Van Nuys. Organized by Valley Trauma Center Valley Trauma Center is a nonprofit, multicultural organization dedicated to the elimination of sexual and interpersonal violence and the development of healthy individuals and families through healing, empowerment, and increased public awareness. Valley Trauma Center is a nonprofit, multicultural organization dedicated to the elimination of sexual and interpersonal violence and the development of healthy individuals and families through healing, empowerment, and increased public awareness.

properties.name: Public Speaking Meetup Group
properties.description: Posted by ChrisI will be on vacation for 2 or so weeks end of Aug, beg. of Sept - hence the gap between meetups. You\'re welcome to join us & not participate in any of the activities. Just sit at the back of the room & observe. We\'ll respect your wishes & allow you to observe without singling you out, & as rude as it may sound to some, we\'ll completely ignore you if this is your wish. You are free to leave at any point of the evening if you are uncomfortable or need to leave. No one will judge you or wonder where you\'re going. We understand. 6:30 p.m. - 6:45 p.m. - Members arrive & Miko does brief introduction 6:45 - 7 p.m. - split into groups of 2 or 3 & ask each other simple questions ie. where are you from, student or working & where, siblings, general interests, etc. & jot down some quick notes. 7 - 7:15 p.m. - Reconvene & make a brief 30 sec introduction to the rest of the group about the person you just met. They will do the same about you. 7:15 - 8:15 p.m. - Presentations are made by the group members that would like to-have something prepared. (Some examples of speech topics by members include a book review, reading a poem, discussing summer plans, reading from a People magazine, history of Japanese Canadians, Einstein\'s theory, Texas Hold\'em poker, & the list goes on!) 8:15 - 8:30 p.m. - Brief discussion about what elements of the meetup group are working for people, what elements aren\'t & need to be revamped and any other topics that you\'d like to discuss.

properties.name: Razz Death Match
properties.description: Posted by ChrisPlay Razz to the death! First place get .82 Million. Here is how it works. Before game day each player buys a M life insurance policy payable to their estate. All players then write a will bestowing M from their estates to the winner of the game. As players are "eliminated", they are killed by a hired hit man who is paid 0,000 per hit (this is a small "rake" given the 0M handle). The hit man is strategically stationed above the table and of course he does not get paid until the game finishes and the winner is paid, so he has an interest in making sure the game goes smoothly. Anwyay the game is Razz, buy-in is the life insurance policy. Enjoy!

properties.name: Saltsburg Community Days
properties.description: Posted by Chris4th Annual Saltsburg Community Days - Come out on September 8, 9 and 10 for the 4th Annual Saltsburg Community Days. Hours are Friday from 5-9pm, Saturday from 10am-10pm, and Sunday from noon-5pm. Friday night will highlight a car cruise around the Canal Park. Registration begins at 4pm with trophies awarded at 8pm. We will begin the day on Saturday with town wide yard sales at 8:00 am. Maps will be available at the information booth on the canal. Saturday festivities will end with Fireworks by Judy at 9 pm. A bicycle and walk poker run is being planned along our trails on Sunday from noon-2pm. Cash prizes will be awarded. All weekend we will have food booths, game booth, crafts, side walk sales, entertainment, 50/50 raffles, Chinese auction baskets, and more. For more information, to register for an event, or participate in a booth set up (5 for a 10 X 10 space) please call Michelle at 724-639-3728 or email dylstin@asdmonline.net.

properties.name: San Francisco Bay Area Poker Meetup Group - 2006 Tournament of Champions!
properties.description: Posted by ChrisHello Group: I salute those of you who persevere past the bulldogs, survive the occasional bad beat and get lucky enough to finish in first place at any of our tournaments. An even more special honor awaits you... Through December 8, 2006 anyone who wins a SF Bay Area Poker Meetup Tournament qualifies for the Tournament of Champions on Saturday, December 9, 2006 at 12:30 PM. The venue has not been chosen yet. More information will follow on the event page as the year progresses. What makes the Tournament of Champions more special? 1) You not only play against the eliite players of the group, you ARE one of the elite players of the group. 2) There is NO BUY-IN! No money out of your pocket. A real cash prize is guaranteed to be at least 00.00. Exact amount will be determined closer to the event date. 3) Our 1st, 2nd and 3rd place winners will receive the prize pool in a 50%/30%/20% split. Rules will be posted on the event page and are subject to change. 4) The winner will receive a special award commemorating this event. Every tournament for the rest of the year leading up to the Tournament of Champions will qualify you for this very special first-time-ever event. DO NOT RSVP FOR THIS EVENT IF YOU DO NOT QUALIFY!! Good Luck!

properties.name: Texas Hold 'Em Night
properties.description: Posted by ChrisMatt and I are hosting a Texas Hold \'Em Party at our apartment. Matt will be giving lessons for those who don\'t know how to play. And I\'ll provide cheat sheets for those of us who don\'t play poker enough to remember what hand beats what. This will be low stakes poker so don\'t expect to go home rich. Probably we will just have each game cost about five dollars (or some other agreed upon amount) and with that you get 40 chips (or some other agreed upon amount) and then whoever has all the chips at the end wins the money. We have plenty of chips and cards. But may need an extra card table and some chairs. I\'ll have some munchies but if you have a favorite feel free to bring it. And we can always order pizza. Both Velvet Melvin and Star pizza deliver to our apartment and are close. This will be BYOB and I\'ll make sure we have ice. If you RSVP yes please put if you\'ll be bringing anything and what that is. Because our apartment is small, I do need to limit the number of people who can attend and I am not offering a maybe. So if you say yes and then find you can\'t go please email me when you cancel so I can let the next person in line know. And if you want to go to this event and it is full please email me, just click the envelope by my name, with your email and phone number and I\'ll contact to you as soon as there is an opening. Email me with questions. I\'ll email the yeses directions to our apartment as the event gets closer.

properties.name: The Augusta Poker Meetup
properties.description: Posted by Chris

properties.name: The Bellevue-East Side Poker Meetup
properties.description: Posted by ChrisSeattle Poker Open is starting it\'s Fall Season! The season will last 15 weeks, and end with a Championship event held at Tulalip Casino. All events are FREE, and you will earn points that are tabulated to determine your rank in the league. Nightly prizes will also be awarded to the winners of every tournament. New this season: Divisions! Each hosting bar will be it\'s own Division of the league, and your points will acrue for that Division only. Can\'t play more than 1 night a week? No problem! You now have equal footing to compete in the league, as we\'ll be taking the top points leaders from each division to the Championship. We\'ll also be sending 1 player every week of the season up to Tulalip with a FREE BUY-IN to their Saturday Tournament. Plus other special advantages for League Members. Sign up online, or come any event 30 minutes prior to the posted Deal Time. Play well, play often. www.SeattlePokerOpen.com

properties.name: The Buffalo Poker Meetup

They have set up some really great food and drink specials for us so you should definetly come out hungry and thirsty. Come see our tournaments website at www.capitalpokerleague.com

properties.name: The Club Poker Challenge XVII [Online Tournament]
properties.description: Posted by ChrisWHAT IS IT? The Club Poker Challenge is a series of regular ONLINE private poker tournaments held over the course of the year for poker clubs from all over Europe who like to compete against one another. Like LPM and The Friday Night Poker Club, many of the players know each other from playing regularly live and over the course of the last couple of years attendance has grown steadily so that now it is probably the largest regular private tournament to be found online. Competition is typically very aggressive, and very loose. And very French. It\'s a friendly, extremely competitive tournament and amazingly well attended, with prize pools regularly topping k and up (200 runners +). WHERE IS IT HELD? Club Poker recognises PokerStars as being the number one site for tournament poker, and so naturally chose to organize their competitions there. Because of their close relationship with \'Stars they are able to offer larger starting stacks, longer levels, and often Pokerstars \'big names\' like Tom McEvoy and Isabelle Mercier jump in to their tourneys and have a go with the rest of us. On top of all that, all tournaments results are tracked over the course of the year and the overall champion receives a fully paid up entry to the EPT (European Poker Tour) in Deauville in 2007. All group members are welcome to come and have a go if they think they\'re hard enough. Several of us have final tabled one of these, but so far only Duncan (dax666) has pulled off a win.

properties.name: The King of TV Show
properties.description: Posted by Chris The King of TV ShowThe King of TV Show, hosted by Paul Goebel (the King himself) uses a talk show format to interview famous faces from tv, past and present. The interviews provide little-known facts about these celebrities, stories from their lives and a chance to "meet" them in an informal setting.Thursday, August 31 FREAKS AND GEEKS REUNION! FeaturingJohn Francis Daley (Sam Weir)Samm Levine (Neal Schweiber)Busy Philipps (Kim Kelly)Steve Bannos (Frank Kowchevski)thekingoftv.comI had a great time. -David CrossI don't know how Paul gets all those great guests but somehow he does it. -Graham Elwood (Cram, Strip Poker)Paul Goebel isn't only The King of TV, he's the King of Making Patton Oswalt Fall In Love With The King of TV -Patton Oswalt (The King of Queens)Part talk show, part quiz show, part improv comedy, Paul Goebel's show is 100% fun; a night of theater without all that pesky thinking. -Andy Richter (Andy Richter Controls the Universe, Late Night)If you're like me and you spend your days surfing Ebay for Chevy Chase talk show memorabilia, Tivo-ing old episodes of What's Happening Now and reading novelizations of Charles in Charge this show is for you -Paul Scheer (VH-1's Best Week Ever) The King of TV ShowThe King of TV Show, hosted by Paul Goebel (the King himself) uses a talk show format to interview famous faces from tv, past and present. properties.name: The Olympia Poker Meetup
properties.description: Posted by ChrisThe Seattle Poker Open\'s Winter Season is underway! The season will last 14 weeks, and end with a Championship event held at Tulalip Casino. All events are FREE, and you will earn points that are tabulated to determine your rank in the league. Nightly prizes will also be awarded to the winners of every tournament. New this season: - VIP Membership - LOTS of perks for those that want to step up their level of participation. Membership has it\'s privileges! - Each Division has it\'s own format. That\'s right each night of the week will have it\'s own structure of Hold\' Em. Choose from Standard Format, Extended Format or a night full of Sit \'N Go\'s. - New location! - Welcome The Pike Brew Pub in historic Pike\'s Market to our list of Hosts. We\'ll still be sending 1 player every week of the season up to Tulalip with a FREE BUY-IN to their Saturday Tournament. Plus other special advantages for League Members. Sign up online, or come any event 30 minutes prior to the posted Deal Time. Play well, play often. www.SeattlePokerO pen.com

properties.name: The Portland Poker Meetup
properties.description: Posted by ChrisPortland Poker Meetup -------------- Description: The regular Tuesday night game at the new location. This event will now feature one No Limit Texas Hold\'em tournament. It will be a 0 buy in with one optional 0 re buy. Prizes will be paid out based on the number of paid entries. Registration will begin @ 6:40. This tournament will start shortly after 7pm. There will be no buy-ins allowed after the completion of the first round. Please arrive early so we can start on time. ------------- Elite Events 11904 NE Halsey Portland, OR

properties.name: The biggest names in rodeo compete in the ProRodeo Tour Championship followed by big-time music artists in concert. Visit Christmas Stampede, a holiday marketplace filled with unique, one-of-a-kind gifts. The Pace Cattle Drive on November 8 includes 100 head of longhorn cattle driven through the middle of downtown Dallas. The La Riata Gala & Texas Hold 'Em Poker Tournament is held in late October. Benefits the Children's Medical Center and the pediatric programs at UT Southwestern Medical Center.

properties.name: Third Annual Gulf Coast Hot Air Balloon Festival
properties.description: Posted by ChrisMore than 45 hot-air balloons, arts and crafts, children's village, motorcycle poker run, live entertainment, Southern cuisine. Festival hours: Fri. & Sat., 9 a.m.-10 p.m.; Sun., 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Balloon & tether rides, Fri., 7:30 p.m.; Balloon flights, Sat., 6:30 a.m. & 6 p.m.; Sun., 6:30 a.m. Note: Balloons are only visible within two hours of sunrise and two hours before sunset and all flights subject to weather. More than 45 hot-air balloons, arts and crafts, children's village, motorcycle poker run, live entertainment, Southern cuisine. Festival hours: Fri. & Sat., 9 a.m.-10 p.m.; Sun., 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Balloon & tether rides, Fri., 7:30 p.m.; Balloon flights, Sat., 6:30 a.m. & 6 p.m.; Sun., 6:30 a.m. Note: Balloons are only visible within two hours of sunrise and two hours before sunset and all flights subject to weather. properties.name: Thunder Valley Rally Poker Run
properties.description: Posted by ChrisThe poker run and bike show benefits Toys for Tots of northern Arizona. Registration required.

properties.name: United Married Women's Meetup Day-September
properties.description: Posted by ChrisLadies\' Poker Night! Some of you have requested this & we\'re going to give it a try. We have access to the same "venue" the Charlotte Poker Meetup Group meets at every Wednesday in Mint Hill. It\'s air-conditioned and has a fridge for any bevs. (alcoholic or non) we would like to have out there. Feel free to bring drinks, mixers or snacks. My husband will disown me for this but I know NOTHING about poker. Melissa hosts games on a regular basis and is going to handle the details of the game itself. She said she\'ll allow plenty of time for teaching at the beginning. Don\'t worry about money. We can buy in for or just play for free- whatever everyone wants to do. The idea is to have fun! :)

properties.name: Western Oklahoma River Road Poker Run
properties.description: Posted by ChrisThis 225 mile motorcycle poker run will travel through the scenic countryside of Blaine, Custer and Dewey counties. Route will feature some state highways, but mostly farm-market paved roads. Three meals included.

properties.name: Whole Hawg Poker Run
properties.description: Posted by ChrisPoker run by boat with the largest prizes on the lake. Cards picked up at marina locations around Lake Eufaula. Held in conjunction with 23rd Annual Whole Hawg Days. Registration via mail, in person or on web site.
